abstracts.cdata!:
The Sierra Leone Hydro Electric Project
            had been developed to provide electricity to the Western
            Area of Freetown and some major towns along the transmission
            Line. Compensation for the loss of property, land, house
            crops etc., is in consonance with the World Bank operational
            policy O.P 4:12 on in voluntary relocation and resettlement.
            Project affected peoples' (PAPs) who had been
            identified during the census stage of the update were to
            benefit from compensations of moving and transition
            allowances. This is not however a compensation per-sae, for
            the loss of property, but rather a means to enhance
            households to transport their belongings from their previous
            settlements to new locations. To some households, the moving
            and transition allowances served as 'seed money'
            for starting a small business. Additionally in kind
            compensation of a hundred acre land has been provided by the
            Ministry of Lands and Country Planning as a resettlement
            site for PAPs who are asset owners and who had lost their
            properties to the project. PAPS were issued identification
            cards and reference code numbers according to their
            categories. A total number of 1,579 respondents were
            recorded as eligible recipients of the moving transition
            allowances. The Sierra Leone Commercial Bank was contracted
            to make direct payments to all PAPS.
